Material used.Description: Wild-type and knockout MEFs were used as controls.

Readout description.Result Description: Protein expression levels were significantly reduced in cells expressing the M26I variant.
Protein stability was impaired, leading to increased degradation of the mutant protein.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each condition.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 protein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells transfected with an empty vector served as the negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression levels above 80% of wild-type control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression levels below 50% of wild-type control.

Readout description.Result Description: The M26I variant showed reduced interaction with ASK1 compared to wild-type DJ-1.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was processed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 and ASK1 co-expression served as the positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells transfected with only one construct (either DJ-1 or ASK1) served as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Analysis of variance (ANOVA) was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Co-IP signal intensity above 80% of wild-type control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Co-IP signal intensity below 50% of wild-type control.
